skill.author: Chachamaru127

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and guidelines. No executable scripts, network operations, or credential access. The skill uses standard development tools (Read, Write, Edit, Grep, Glob, Bash) appropriate for its implementation purpose.

low_findings.title: Bash tool usage for build commands
low_findings.description: The skill permits Bash tool usage for running development commands like `cat Plans.md`, `npm test`, and `npx tsc --noEmit`. While these are legitimate development operations documented in the skill, shell command execution always carries inherent risk if used carelessly.

content.value_statement: Features and tests often get delayed when developers focus on coding. This skill provides structured workflows to implement planned features and write tests efficiently while maintaining code quality.
actual_capabilities: Implement features based on Plans.md task definitions
Write unit tests for implemented functionality
Follow quality gates for security and TDD patterns
limitations: Does not perform code review or verification
Requires Plans.md to exist with defined tasks
Does not handle deployment or release processes

use_cases.title: Feature implementation
use_cases.description: Implement features from Plans.md with quality checks and test coverage

use_cases.title: Test creation
use_cases.description: Write comprehensive tests for implemented features using established patterns

use_cases.title: Task tracking
use_cases.description: Track implementation progress and update Plans.md status automatically

prompt_templates.title: Basic implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement the feature defined in Plans.md. Start by finding tasks marked with cc:WIP.

prompt_templates.title: With testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement the feature and write tests for it. Follow the TDD pattern. Check the testing framework first.

prompt_templates.title: Security-focused
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement the feature for the authentication module. Run security checks and input validation before completing.

prompt_templates.title: Full workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Complete the current implementation task: run build validation, write tests, update Plans.md status, and report the results.

output_examples.input: Implement the user authentication feature from Plans.md
output: Found task: 'User authentication module' with cc:WIP status
Created src/auth/login.tsx with login form component
Added input validation with proper error handling
Updated Plans.md task status to cc:ÂÆå‰∫Ü

best_practices: Run quality gates before starting implementation to identify TDD or security requirements
Use LSP features like go-to-definition and diagnostics to understand existing patterns
Write tests alongside implementation to maintain code quality
anti_patterns: Hardcoding test expectations instead of writing real logic
Returning stub values like null or empty arrays
Skipping tests to save time during implementation

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: Read, Write, Edit, Grep, Glob, and Bash tools for codebase operations and build validation.

faq.question: Can this skill run arbitrary shell commands?
faq.answer: No. The skill only runs documented commands like npm test or npx tsc for verification.

faq.question: Does this skill access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It only accesses project files defined in Plans.md and required source code.

faq.question: What happens if Plans.md does not exist?
faq.answer: The skill requires Plans.md with defined tasks. Users should create planning documents first.

faq.question: How is this skill different from code review?
faq.answer: This skill focuses on implementation. Code review skills check existing code quality separately.

faq.question: Can this skill deploy to production?
faq.answer: No. This skill handles implementation and testing only. Deployment requires separate skills.
